tool.name: BioMaS
tool.description: - a modular pipeline for Bioinformatic analysis of Metagenomic AmpliconS
tool.command:
python $__tool_directory__/biomas_wrapper.py
## First sequence file -p1 "${seq_1}"
## Second sequence file -p2 "${seq_2}"
## output prefix -b biomas_output
## function folder for cython -F $__tool_directory__
##Â Fragment lenght (optional) ## If zero it is ignored -f "${frag_len}"
## number of threads for Bowtie2 (FIXME currently not enabled. need to modify qcc script). -p \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}
### bowtie2 and TANGO execution ITSoneDB section ### -i "${bowtie2_indexes.fields.path}" -v "${mapping_file.fields.path}" -T "${tango_folder.fields.path}" -d "${tango_dmp.fields.path}"
### tree builder for perl tango ### -n "${node_file.fields.path}"

param.name: bowtie2_indexes
param.label: Bowtie 2 indexes
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact the Galaxy team

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
**BioMaS overview**
BioMaS_ (Bioinformatic analysis of Metagenomic AmpliconS) is a new bioinformatic pipeline designed to support biomolecular researchers involved in taxonomic studies of environmental microbial communities by a completely automated workflow, comprehensive of all the fundamental steps, from raw sequence data upload and cleaning to final taxonomic identification, that are absolutely required in an appropriately designed Meta-barcoding HTS-based experiment.
.. _BioMaS: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-015-0595-z
-----
**Inputs**
BioMaS accepts files in FASTQ format...
-----
**Input options**
Quality check and consensus options::
-f <int> fragment lenght (optional)
